instead of only bind_host and bind_port. This enables you to

subject: Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice
commit_message:
Bug 884863: nova logs everything to syslog twice

Fix double-registration of the syslog handler.
NovaRootLogger.setup_from_flags is called twice from log.setup() -- once
through NovaRootLogger.__init__ and once through reset().  setup_from_flags
wasn't idempotent, so this resulted in the syslog handler being registered
twice.

Rather than fix the twisty-turny maze that is setup(), I've opted to make
setup_from_flags idempotent in this regard, by always unregistering the
syslog handler before doing anything else.

(cherry picked from commit a807c57f5b61cb25a6f5c140a97ed744ab0a70dd)

Bug #888719: openvswitch-nova runs after firstboot scripts

Move openvswitch-nova to 23 in the boot order.

The openvswitch-nova init.d script used on XenServer has been set to run
at 96 in the boot order (i.e. very late).  This is inconvenient, because it
means that it runs after the firstboot scripts, so if you want to do an
automated install of a compute VM, say, you can't rely on the Open vSwitch
rules being ready.

23 places it after the networking start up (9 through 14) and before the
firstboot scripts (24).

subject: Follow hostname RFCs / Remove hostname storage
commit_message:
Follow hostname RFCs / Remove hostname storage

Currently when a server is created, a hostname is generated from
the 'display_name'. If the 'display_name' is not present, a hostname
will be generated looking like "Server XXXX" where XXXX is the ID.

Storing the hostname in the database is redundant, as display_name
is already stored. This patch removes the 'hostname' column and
simply passes the entire instance down to the virt layer so that it
can decide what to set the hostname to for an instance.

Also, hostname sanitization should now more closely follow RFC-952
and RFC-1123.

subject: Remove nova dependency on vconfig on Linux.
commit_message:
Remove nova dependency on vconfig on Linux.

iproute2 is already a dependency and is used everywhere and is more
capable than vconfig. This commit just replaces all uses of vconfig.

Change-Id: I5860a10f151a176bf9849feda6052d4c2b491e07

subject: Bug #875995: Quantum README fixes
commit_message:
Bug #875995: Quantum README fixes

Fix the most obvious issues with the Quantum README and add pointers to
external documentation resources.

In a future commit, we plan to remove most of the content in the README
and leave it just as references to external documentation.  However,
this change requires us to be able to support multiple version of our
external documentation (not yet possible) and have a good location for
developer documentation.

Change-Id: I57d7f99f070d17564b7a5fdcef8ae8ad2a6575a6
